bestBHT.bht: In that day, when men treat you in this same way, you should leap for joy with lively celebration. Rejoice as if the greatest honor and happiness imaginable has been bestowed upon you. Just as their fathers had done to the prophets, so will they receive a prophet's reward. For behold, your reward is great in heaven.

Henry Alford: 23.] in that day, not in the most solemn sense of the words (eee Matt. vii. 22), but in the day when men shall do thus to you.
Marvin Vincent: Leap for joy [σκιρτησατε] . See chapter Luke 1:41, Luke 1:44. Compare Matthew, be exceeding glad (ajgalliasqe : see on 1 Peter 1:6).
Philip Schaff: Luke 6:23. In that day, i.e., the day when this happens to you; not in the great day of the future, as in Matthew 7:22.
Leap for joy . Peculiar to Luke.
Archibald T. Robertson: Thus they will receive a prophet's reward.
John Gill: Rejoice ye in that day... and leap for joy; as if the greatest honour and happiness imaginable had been conferred on them; and as persons do, when in the greatest rapture.
For behold, your reward is great in heaven.
For in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.

bhtAttempts.bht: In that day, when men treat you in this same way, you should leap for joy with lively celebration. Rejoice as if the greatest honor and happiness imaginable has been bestowed upon you. Just as their fathers had done to the prophets, so will they receive a prophet's reward. For behold, your reward is great in heaven.

In the day when men treat you in such a way, you are to leap for joy. This joy is not ordinary, but a lively and exultant joy. It is as if the greatest honor and happiness imaginable has been bestowed upon you, similar to the reward bestowed upon the prophets, as their fathers had done to them. Your reward, too, will be great in heaven.

In Luke 6:23, it is written that in the day when people treat others in a certain way, they are to leap for joy. This call to rejoice in such circumstances is described as an expression of the greatest honor and happiness, akin to being in the greatest rapture imaginable. It is a response to the reward that awaits them in heaven, a reward similar to what was given to the prophets throughout history.

In the day when men shall do thus to you, it is said that you are to leap for joy, as if the greatest honor imaginable has been conferred upon you. This response of rejoicing is a reflection of the reward that awaits you in heaven. Just as the fathers of old treated the prophets in a similar manner, so will you receive a prophet's reward for enduring such treatment.

In the day when men shall do thus to you, it is said that you are to leap for joy as if the greatest honor imaginable has been conferred upon you. This response of rejoicing is a reflection of the reward that awaits you in heaven. Just as the fathers of old treated the prophets in a similar manner, so will you receive a prophet's reward for enduring such treatment.
